intro: Ascidieria palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan starvine, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often fragrant. Ascidieria palawanensis is typically found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and rocky slopes.
